Class FSMState

This represents a single "state" within your FSM (Finite State Machine) blueprint. ðŸŒŸ Think of it as a specific condition or behavior an object can be in, like "Standing," "Jumping," or "Attacking."

sequenceDiagram participant E as onEnter participant U as onUpdate participant X as onExit E->>U: Start state actions U-->>U: Loop actions U->>X: Exit state

Namespace: TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API
Assembly: FSM_API.dll
Syntax
public class FSMState
Remarks

Each FSMState has a unique name and can have three special "actions" linked to it:

  • OnEnter:What happens **when you first arrive** in this state.
  • OnUpdate:What happens **repeatedly while you are** in this state.
  • OnExit:What happens **just before you leave** this state.

These actions receive an IStateContext, which is like a data bag ðŸŽ’ containing all the specific information your FSM instance needs to perform its actions.

While you'll typically set up your states easily using a builder tool, this class is available for advanced users who might need to create or change states directly in their code.

Constructors

| Edit this page View Source

FSMState(string, Action<IStateContext>, Action<IStateContext>, Action<IStateContext>)

Creates a new state definition for your FSM blueprint.

Declaration
public FSMState(string name, Action<IStateContext> onEnter, Action<IStateContext> onUpdate, Action<IStateContext> onExit)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string name

The unique name for this state (e.g., "Idle", "Running").
Action<IStateContext> onEnter

An optional action to run when the FSM enters this state. Can be null.
Action<IStateContext> onUpdate

An optional action to run repeatedly while in this state. Can be null.
Action<IStateContext> onExit

An optional action to run when the FSM leaves this state. Can be null.
Remarks

When creating a state, you must give it a unique name. You can also optionally provide actions to run onEnter, onUpdate, and onExit. If you don't provide an action for any of these, it will simply do nothing.

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

This happens if you try to create a state without a proper name (it's empty or just spaces).

Properties

| Edit this page View Source

Name

This is the unique name for this state. Once you create a state with a name, it can't be changed.

Declaration
public string Name { get; }

Type Description
string

Methods

| Edit this page View Source

Enter(IStateContext)

Runs the 'OnEnter' action for this state.

Declaration
public void Enter(IStateContext c)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IStateContext c

The context object specific to this FSM instance, providing data access.
Remarks

The FSM system calls this method automatically when an FSM instance transitions into this state. After this method runs, the state's HasEnteredCurrentState flag is set to true.

| Edit this page View Source

Exit(IStateContext)

Runs the 'OnExit' action for this state.

Declaration
public void Exit(IStateContext c)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IStateContext c

The context object specific to this FSM instance, providing data access.
Remarks

The FSM system calls this method automatically just before an FSM instance transitions out of this state to another.

| Edit this page View Source

SetOnEnter(Action<IStateContext>)

Sets the action that will run when the FSM first moves into this state.

Declaration
public void SetOnEnter(Action<IStateContext> enter)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Action<IStateContext> enter

The action (a piece of code) to run when entering, or null if no action is needed.
Remarks

This action receives a context object that provides all the necessary data for this FSM instance. If you don't provide an action (leave it null), nothing special will happen when the FSM enters this state.

| Edit this page View Source

SetOnExit(Action<IStateContext>)

Sets the action that will run just before the FSM leaves this state.

Declaration
public void SetOnExit(Action<IStateContext> exit)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Action<IStateContext> exit

The action (a piece of code) to run when exiting, or null if no action is needed.
Remarks

This action receives a context object with the FSM's current data. If you don't provide an action (leave it null), nothing special will happen when the FSM exits this state.

| Edit this page View Source

SetOnUpdate(Action<IStateContext>)

Sets the action that will run repeatedly while the FSM is currently in this state.

Declaration
public void SetOnUpdate(Action<IStateContext> update)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Action<IStateContext> update

The action (a piece of code) to run during updates, or null if no action is needed.
Remarks

This action receives a context object with the FSM's current data. If you don't provide an action (leave it null), nothing special will happen during each update cycle while in this state.

| Edit this page View Source

Update(IStateContext)

Runs the 'OnUpdate' action for this state.

Declaration
public void Update(IStateContext c)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IStateContext c

The context object specific to this FSM instance, providing data access.
Remarks

The FSM system typically calls this method regularly while an FSM instance is staying in this state, often as part of a game's update loop.
